summary: Interlinear gloss to the following hymns: Nobis ece dies; Surgentes ad te; Sancte dei; Audi benigne; Summe largitor; Maria Mater (stanzas 1-4); Gabriel dei; and a few lines of Eterne rerem; also part of Sic ter quaternis

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 11v) forgif beorhtne æfen | þæt næfre ne fealle lif ac þonne | stande ece ƿuldor mede | haliges deades (incipit of the first texts)

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ( fol. 117v) forgife þes dæg on ðam þe þu | behyltst gehalgod ƿeofod | þe ece gefean | us ˥ he þeo on langum | bryce tide (explicit of the final texts)

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ( fol. 125v) eala drihten gemiltsa ure þe ƿe | anbidedan soðlice beo þu ure | earnum on ærnemorgen ˥ ure hæl on | tide gedrefednysse

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ( fol. 155v) swynugie eall flaesc fram ansine drihten | forthornon thorne he samoduparas of his halgan | wynununge

admin: Described by Owen Roberson with the assistance of Sanne van der Schee, with reference to published scholarship (2010, 2012).
